column1: Paso de los Libres is a city in the east of the province of Corrientes in the Argentine Mesopotamia. It had about 44
column3: and is the head town of the department of the same name.

column1: The city lies on the right-hand (western) shore of the Uruguay River
column5: to which it is joined by a road and railway bridge (Paso de los Libres-Uruguaiana International Bridge). The area is served by Paso de los Libres Airport.

column1: Municipal information: Municipal Affairs Federal Institute (IFAM)
